questions.text: Which 'Big 8' radio station from Windsor, Ontario dominated the airwaves in Detroit and Ohio?
questions.explanation: CKLW ('The Big 8') was a legendary 50,000-watt station heard clearly across the region.

questions.text: Joe Walsh gained fame with which Cleveland-based band before joining the Eagles?
questions.explanation: The James Gang, formed in Cleveland in 1966, featured Joe Walsh on guitar/vocals.

questions.text: Which Akron band is famous for 'Whip It' and their flower pot hats?
questions.explanation: DEVO formed at Kent State University and became New Wave icons.

questions.text: The Isley Brothers, famous for 'Shout' and 'Twist and Shout', hail from:
questions.explanation: The family group started in Cincinnati in the 1950s.

questions.text: Chrissie Hynde, leader of The Pretenders, is from which Ohio city?
questions.explanation: She famously sang about it in 'My City Was Gone'.

questions.text: Which Cleveland radio station was known as 'The Buzzard'?
questions.explanation: 100.7 WMMS was one of the most influential rock stations in the country.

questions.text: The O'Jays ('Love Train') were a key part of the 'Sound of _____'.
questions.explanation: Though from Canton, Ohio, they defined the Sound of Philadelphia.
Wild Cherry was a funk rock band from Steubenville, Ohio.

questions.text: The Ohio Players had a #1 hit in 1975 with:
questions.explanation: 'Fire' and 'Love Rollercoaster' were massive hits for the Dayton funk band.
The King of Cool was born Dino Crocetti in Steubenville.

questions.text: Which concert venue near Cleveland was legendary for its rock shows in the 70s and 80s?
questions.explanation: All were major venues, but Richfield Coliseum (opened 1974) hosted the biggest acts.

questions.text: Screamin' Jay Hawkins ('I Put a Spell on You') was from:
questions.explanation: He was born and raised in Cleveland.

questions.text: Nine Inch Nails frontman Trent Reznor started his career in:
questions.explanation: Reznor worked at a studio in Cleveland while recording 'Pretty Hate Machine'.

questions.text: Which DJ is credited with coining the term 'Rock and Roll' in Cleveland?
questions.explanation: Alan Freed popularized the term on his Moondog House radio show in the early 50s.

questions.text: Bootsy Collins, legendary funk bassist, is associated with which city?
questions.explanation: Bootsy Collins rose to prominence in Cincinnati's vibrant funk scene.
